mapper.sql: id, create_datetime, description, icon, name, resource_type, seq, states, url, pid
mapper.select: select distinct re.* from sys_resource re join sys_role_resource rr on re.id = rr.resource_id join sys_role r on r.id = rr.role_id join sys_user_role ur on ur.role_id = r.id join sys_user u on u.id = ur.user_id where u.login_name = #{_parameter}
select r1.*,r2.name as pname from sys_resource r1 left OUTER join sys_resource r2 on r1.pid = r2.id where r1.id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}

select distinct t1.*,t2.name as pname from sys_resource t1 left OUTER join sys_resource t2 on t1.pid = t2.id
and t1.resource_type = #{resourceType}
and t1.pid is null
order by t1.seq
mapper.update:
update sys_resource
create_datetime = #{createDatetime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},

seq = #{seq,jdbcType=INTEGER},

where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
